alert.note: Alert for Red River (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 5:26PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Little River, southwestern Sevier, southeastern McCurtain and east central Red River Counties through 600 PM CST... At 525 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles south of Idabel, or 15 miles northeast of Clarksville, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Horatio, Foreman, Winthrop, Arkinda, Haworth, Bokhoma, Moon, Cerrogordo, Goodlake, Harris, Goodwater, Shinewell, Tom, America, West Line, Bryarly and West Otis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for southwestern Arkansas...southeastern Oklahoma...and northeastern Texas.
